customer_addr:
3172 N. Rainbow Blvd #340
Las Vegas, NV 89108

citations.narrative:
There was an open bag of cat food on a lower shelf in the cat room and an open box of dog treats on a shelf in the dog
room. Open supplies of food may become contaminated by pests, dust and debris or may deteriorate or spoil so should
be stored or kept in a manner to protect the health of the animals. All open supplies of food must be kept in leak-proof
containers with tightly fitting lids to prevent contamination, deterioration of its nutritive value, and spoilage.
Correct by 03/12/2023.

At the time of inspection two dogs, Terry, a tan, male terrier mix and Archie, a male Siberian Husky were individually
housed in enclosures which did not allow them to have at least 6 inches above their heads while in a normal standing
position. This additional space is required to provide the dogs room for normal postural movements within their
enclosures. The licensee must ensure that the interior height of each primary enclosure is at least 6 inches higher than
the head of the tallest dog in the enclosure when it is in a normal standing position.
Correct by 03/18/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End Section

narrative:
3.1(e) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
There was an open bag of cat food on a lower shelf in the cat room and an open box of dog treats on a shelf in the dog 
room.  Open supplies of food may become contaminated by pests, dust and debris or may deteriorate or spoil so should 
be stored or kept in a manner to protect the health of the animals. All open supplies of food must be kept in leak-proof 
containers with tightly fitting lids to prevent contamination, deterioration of its nutritive value, and spoilage. 
 
Correct by 03/12/2023. 
3.6(c)(1)(iii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
At the time of inspection two dogs, Terry, a tan, male terrier mix and Archie, a male Siberian Husky were individually 
housed in enclosures which did not allow them to have at least 6 inches above their heads while in a normal standing 
position. This additional space is required to provide the dogs room for normal postural movements within their 
enclosures. The licensee must ensure that the interior height of each primary enclosure is at least 6 inches higher than 
the head of the tallest dog in the enclosure when it is in a normal standing position.

Correct by 03/18/2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End Section
